commit message:
updated http:// to https://

Just shows how many places have a hard-coded URL. There'd be a better long-term solution to this, albeit it is unlikely this will ever come up again (unless SG goes back to http://)

As previously broken by https://www.steamgifts.com/discussion/ppoZ7/https; fixes #32

HTML + API for hiding games have changed, thus breaking the giveaway list (where we, by extent, used to access game IDs) as well as hiding games in general.

As previously broken by https://www.steamgifts.com/discussion/QQvgS/hide-games-faster, fixes #30
